Title: It is not permissible to say that you were present at a lecture from which you were absent
Ques: I am a college student. Is it permissible for me to say that I was present at a lecture which I did not attend, with the knowledge of the supervisor, who in fact sometimes asks us to do this?.
Ans:
Praise be to Allah.
    It is not permissible for you to say that you were present at 
    a lecture from which you were absent, because this is lying. The supervisor 
    has no right to allow you to do that, because that is cooperating in sin and 
    betraying a trust. Allaah says (interpretation of the meaning): 

    “Help you one another in Al‑Birr and At‑Taqwa (virtue, 
    righteousness and piety); but do not help one another in sin and 
    transgression. And fear Allaah. Verily, Allaah is Severe in punishment”

    [al-Maa’idah 5:2]
And Allaah knows best.
